turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kuwait National Assembly No-Confidence Votes.
turn.2: MPs Waleed AlـTabtabaie, Jamaan Al-Hirbish, and Ahmad Al-Shihoumi grilled the minister in February 2007, questioning him about allegations of favoritism, deteriorating health services offered by state hospitals, and wasting public money by sending people for treatment abroad at the country's expense when they could be treated at home.
turn.3: Did the minister answer the questions?
turn.4: The minister defended himself against accusations of mismanagement and incompetence, acknowledging he made mistakes and has asked the prosecutor general to investigate.
turn.5: What happened after he defended himself?
turn.6: But lawmakers were unconvinced and decided he should face a vote of no confidence.
turn.7: Did he face the vote of no confidence?
turn.8: The cabinet then resigned on March 4, one day before the vote of no confidence was to take place.
turn.10: MPs Musallam Al-Barrak, Abdulla Al-Roumi, and Adel Al-Saraawi grilled the minister, who then resigned before a no-confidence vote could be held.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: On August 25, 2007, Faisal Al-Muslim Al-Otaib and Islamist MP Waleed AlـTabtabaie submitted to Speaker Jassem Al-Kharafi a motion to grill Health Minister Maasouma Al-Mubarak following the August 23rd Jahra Hospital fire which led to the death of two elderly patients.
